page.title: 07Farming: Trewinnard Manor
page.content: Between dates set by the Ministry that is the end of June to the end of July the sheep, other than those pregnant are dipped. The process of dipping means that the sheep are completely submerged under a liquid designed to kill off scab etc. On the farm much grass is cut for silage and hay. Also on the farm daffodils are grown in large quantities and cut in January and February to catch the early markets in such places as Sheffield. Glasgow and Convent Garden <London), these flowers can be kept in a freezer on the farm if necessary to keep fresh.
